intro: Nageia fleuryi, commonly known as the Fleurys' nageia, is a rare evergreen conifer native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its slender, upward-curving cones and needle-like leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and limited distribution. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
